reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright so I barely played this so perhaps this won't be the best review but then again I barely played it for a reason. So for starters this game will make you question your PC when you click Play Game" and it freezes. After multiple times starting the game and it crashing I decided to just leave it on "not responding" to see what happens. About roughly 5 minutes later the game finally loaded.

"HOW AWESOME WAS IT?" you ask? Not awesome.

It starts with a super laggy and not well done camera pan from the skies down to your player whos laying on the ground
date:
but isn't touching the ground. You then get up having full control over the player but not enough control to fight the terrible frame rate this game runs on. Within about 0.0007 seconds you're going to notice that the game looks absolutely nothing like it does on the steam store page and you're going to feel violated that you spent 3 $5 footlongs worth of money on this instead of enjoying your favourite meatball sub watching reruns of Breaking Bad on Netflix.

I did however manage to traverse down the mountain to a crate in which I found some fruit. I wish I could say this was one of the good things about this game but I can't because the inventory UI was awful.

I hope these developers improve on this game signifigantly and makes this review look silly but once you play for yourself you'll see that quite frankly this review was actually very nice.

"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access Launch Day...  My YouTube Hour long Early Access Launch Day Review Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YO4s0OqrkYg

I bought the game less then an hour after it launched in early access on Steam..

Four fatal errors of which one hard locked up my PC requiring a hard reboot.

Then the game, even set at minimum graphics quality settings for everything was stuttering and running awful.  ..The good thing is the devs who are two 18 year old kids quickly put out a texture patch to make the game process the textures better on lower then high end gaming rigs and the game was actually playable!  YAY!

So then I deleted my first video on my youtube channel and was able to replace it with a full hour long first impressions and early access review video!

The bad news is that while the game was very playable now, I walked around for that full hour.. and I walked some more.. and I walked some more.  And still yet.. I walked some more!  There are NO creatures, friendly or hostile in this game at early access launch.  Resource gathering requires you explore the world enough to find the tools required to gather different types of resources.  So you will spend a LOT of time walking around the map.  Alone.  With weird glitches and oddities plentiful.  I found two pickaxes in a barrel sitting in the most bizarre spot off the trail.  Trying to simply equip the pickaxe, I magically turned it into 6 pickaxes!  Trails that you should be able to follow sometimes present invisible walls that can't be passed unless you jiggle and finess your character at exactly the right angle and spot in order to move on.  Shadows from trees seem to have epileptic seizures all around you making you get excited and think you saw some other creature off in the tall grass, but then realize that its just another weird graphical phenominon of this game.

While the world they have created shows promise and like a place I would someday like to have epic battles for my life in, this world now is just as blah and heartless as a skeletal corpse void of any life at all.  There is nothing here that makes you want to play.. or stay.  Atleast today on early access launch day anyhow.

Sadly, this is just another game that was released in early access way way way too early by a couple of teenages way way way too eager to see their baby out on Steam.  I'm sure they both had and still have high dreams for this game, and I hope that they don't lose their passion and vision of what they plan for it.  My mission however is to score this game the same way I do every game I review on Steam and protect potential disappointed customers.

At the time of this review on its launch day of its early access, I don't see the game being even close to what it should" be for a very long time... at least a year away
date: and that's if the developers continue to work very hard on it and keep their faith.  I hope that I am wrong
recommended:
but I forsee this game being yet another abandoned early access survival game that once had developers with incredible visions and even more promises to any customers who would support them.

At the time of this review:
This game scores an F
"While it shows some hope
hoursPlayed: it just feels like it was released at least a year too early."\n\nWatch my video link above for a much more in depth review and all the reasons for why I scored it that way that I did.  Not recommended until this game is closer to 70% complete rather then the 15% complete it feels like it's at right now... and that's problably a long ways off
voteText: if it ever gets there and doesn't get abandoned first.\n\n* Please Note:  Suspected Shady Developers Behavior Early After Early Access Launch....  This game is getting "mysterious" positive reviews to counter the negative reviews.  No actual written postives yet
helpfulPercent: but just postives to help counter the negatives it's getting on Steam so far.  Are the developers giving copies to friends
votesTotal: and/or alt Steam accounts to hop in and add these mysterious positive scores?  - I wouldn't be surprised.  I could be wrong
votesFunny: but be wary!  Too many of these type of early access games that score this low from me seem to have developers trying to pull all kinds of this kind of shady behavior to desperately try and help them keep some sales coming. :-("

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe screenshots make this game look somewhat interesting and playable. I'm here to tell you NO...JUST...NO! Stay away from this one. Early Access Review

Unreal engine 4? ;) really? this looks like crap, on screens and in video looks good but when you play it it will not look even remotely close to that.
blurry low resolution textures, geometry popping, noticeable tileable textures on ground, shiny tree bark? :) jagged low resolution shadows, etc.
No one playing and no proper single player since 2012
well this is as dead as it can be, don't waste you time on this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My sister gave this game to me as a free gift, it's a game running on a good engine, with awful graphical glitches, pop in that is 10 metres in front of you, awful performance and the recent patch made the game not even work

And it's £10.99!

Makes Early Access look bad.


EDIT: Recent patch has fixed performance issues, has also fixed the pop in, there is now actually a health/water and food bar so you don't randomly die for no reason. Devs are clearly working on this, still would not recommend yet, I still think it should drop in price in its current state

Will say that the game has nice music and the sounds are good.

Graphics are still extremely blurry with terrible textures.

Game has some problems with tabbing out, causing crashes

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game works but there is no multiplayer, can´t find or create any server and I can only play single player. The graphics are nothing like in the video and screenshots and it has too many bugs (it is normal since it is an early access game).
The game isn´t functional enough. I have seen other similar early access games much better and the price of the game is too high for the current state of development of the game.
Regardless what I said before it was a good effort for the developers but the game still have a long way to be a good survival game.
I will change my review/opinion if I see some improvements in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really wanted to like this game. But sadly the game and the screen shots don't match up. The textures are very badly applied. The inventory system sorta works but not really. Had to press esc then tab to get the window from opening something to go away.  Duping problem of items is bad in backpacks. Had 1 flashlight, took it out. next time I opened backpack it had 2 flashlights.
This game needs alot of work.
Nice try but Just put it on follow and come back later. As it stands it's not a very good game. There are way better games out there than this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Had issue running it on my one pc so installed on a much beefier Pc. Ran it and started playing, Graphics are terrible, the controls are even worse. Ran into someone with a sword and a box in front of him, took the stash and went to him and he started attacking me.. I hit him once and he just vanished, eh ok, so i went a little ways down the path and ran into him laying off the path a little.. he was jittering around like he was having a siezure or something.
Inventory is a joke and having to drag things to it isn't fun. Understand there would be issues but this is just a bit too much to play this at the moment for me.  I will change my review when I see work being done to this,but won't recommend it like it is, Im glad I got this dirt cheap because full price is not worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I rated this game as recommended because I believe it has potential and I have to say that I like the idea of having to survive on a desolate island.
However, there is a major problem that is taking away from the experience: Lag.

Aside from the lag and any other bugs, I'd have to say I'm exited to play this game in the future after the early access stage. Please fix the issues soon.

God bless and best regards,
EtherealLife

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This Game has several bugs like the crash when you close the game or the performance but since it's an Alpha-Stage Game and made by !!TWO!! people in their free time, its good. Just look at their map; Its huge and has alot of buildings.

Honestly I have to say, in it's current state this game is more for the newest high-end gaming pc and not some office computer or laptop.
I'm pretty sure the road to the final version is long, very long I'd say.

My general rating is 7/11 once the major issues are fixed, i'll give a 9/11. We should not forget this is an early alpha, so rate like it's one.

Cheerio~~~
